g2501.definition: [Ἰωσήφ] of Hebrew origin ({{h3130}}); Joseph, the name of seven Israelites

g2502.definition: [Ἰωσίας] of Hebrew origin ({{h2977}}); Josias (i.e. Joshiah), an Israelite

g2503.definition: [ἰῶτα] of Hebrew origin (the tenth letter of the Hebrew alphabet); "iota", the name of the eighth letter of the Greek alphabet, put (figuratively) for a very small part of anything

g2504.definition: [κἀγώ] from {{g2532}} and {{g1473}};   so also the dative case        κἀμοί,  and accusative case      κἀμέ        and (or also, even, etc.) I, (to) me

g2505.definition: [καθά] from {{g2596}} and the neuter plural of {{g3739}}; according to which things, i.e. just as

g2507.definition: [καθαιρέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g138}} (including its alternate); to lower (or with violence) demolish (literally or figuratively)

g2508.definition: [καθαίρω] from {{g2513}}; to cleanse, i.e. (specially) to prune; figuratively, to expiate

g2512.definition: [καθαρισμός] from {{g2511}}; a washing off, i.e. (ceremonially) ablution, (morally) expiation

g2513.definition: [καθαρός] of uncertain affinity; clean (literally or figuratively)

g2515.definition: [καθέδρα] from {{g2596}} and the same as {{g1476}}; a bench (literally or figuratively)

g2516.definition: [καθέζομαι] from {{g2596}} and the base of {{g1476}}; to sit down

g2517.definition: [καθεξῆς] from {{g2596}} and {{g1836}}; thereafter, i.e. consecutively; as a noun (by ellipsis of noun) a subsequent person or time

g2518.definition: [καθεύδω] from {{g2596}} and εὕδω (to sleep); to lie down to rest, i.e. (by implication) to fall asleep (literally or figuratively)

g2519.definition: [καθηγητής] from a compound of {{g2596}} and {{g2233}}; a guide, i.e. (figuratively) a teacher

g2520.definition: [καθήκω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2240}}; to reach to, i.e. (neuter of present active participle, figuratively as adjective) becoming

g2521.definition: [κάθημαι] from {{g2596}}; and ἧμαι (to sit; akin to the base of {{g1476}}); to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside

g2523.definition: [καθίζω] another (active) form for {{g2516}}; to seat down, i.e. set (figuratively, appoint); intransitively, to sit (down); figuratively, to settle (hover, dwell)

g2524.definition: [καθίημι] from {{g2596}}; and ἵημι (to send); to lower

g2525.definition: [καθίστημι] from {{g2596}} and {{g2476}}; to place down (permanently), i.e. (figuratively) to designate, constitute, convoy

g2526.definition: [καθό] from {{g2596}} and {{g3739}}; according to which thing, i.e. precisely as, in proportion as

g2527.definition: [καθόλου] from {{g2596}} and {{g3650}}; on the whole, i.e. entirely

g2528.definition: [καθοπλίζω] from {{g2596}}; and {{g3695}}; to equip fully with armor

g2529.definition: [καθοράω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3708}}; to behold fully, i.e. (figuratively) distinctly apprehend

g2530.definition: [καθότι] from {{g2596}}; and {{g3739}} and {{g5100}}; according to which certain thing, i.e. as far (or inasmuch) as

g2531.definition: [καθώς] from {{g2596}} and {{g5613}}; just (or inasmuch) as, that

g2532.definition: [καί] apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words

g2533.definition: [Καϊάφας] of Chaldee origin; the dell; Caiaphas (i.e. Cajepha), an Israelite

g2534.definition: [καίγε] from {{g2532}} and {{g1065}}; and at least (or even, indeed)

g2535.definition: [Κάϊν] of Hebrew origin ({{h7014}}); Cain, (i.e. Cajin), the son of Adam

g2536.definition: [Καϊνάν] of Hebrew origin ({{h7018}}); Cainan (i.e. Kenan), the name of two patriarchs

g2537.definition: [καινός] of uncertain affinity; new (especially in freshness; while {{g3501}} is properly so with respect to age

g2539.definition: [καίπερ] from {{g2532}} and {{g4007}}; and indeed, i.e. nevertheless or notwithstanding

g2540.definition: [καιρός] of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. set or proper time Compare {{g5550}}.

g2541.definition: [Καῖσαρ] of Latin origin; Cæsar, a title of the Roman emperor

g2542.definition: [Καισάρεια] from {{g2541}}; Cæsaria, the name of two places in Palestine

g2543.definition: [καίτοι] from {{g2532}} and {{g5104}}; and yet, i.e. nevertheless

g2544.definition: [καίτοιγε] from {{g2543}} and {{g1065}}; and yet indeed, i.e. although really

g2545.definition: [καίω] apparently a primary verb; to set on fire, i.e. kindle or (by implication) consume

g2546.definition: [κἀκεῖ] from {{g2532}} and {{g1563}}; likewise in that place

g2547.definition: [κἀκεῖθεν] from {{g2532}} and {{g1564}}; likewise from that place (or time)

g2549.definition: [κακία] from {{g2556}}; badness, i.e. (subjectively) depravity, or (actively) malignity, or (passively) trouble

g2550.definition: [κακοήθεια] from a compound of {{g2556}} and {{g2239}}; bad character, i.e. (specially) mischievousness

g2551.definition: [κακολογέω] from a compound of {{g2556}} and {{g3056}}; to revile

g2552.definition: [κακοπάθεια] from a compound of {{g2256}} and {{g3806}}; hardship

g2553.definition: [κακοπαθέω] from the same as {{g2552}}; to undergo hardship

g2554.definition: [κακοποιέω] from {{g2555}}; to be a bad-doer, i.e. (objectively) to injure, or (genitive) to sin

g2555.definition: [κακοποιός] from {{g2556}} and {{g4160}}; a bad-doer; (specially), a criminal

g2556.definition: [κακός] apparently a primary word; worthless (intrinsically, such; whereas {{g4190}} properly refers to effects), i.e. (subjectively) depraved, or (objectively) injurious

g2557.definition: [κακοῦργος] from {{g2556}} and the base of {{g2041}}; a wrong-doer, i.e. criminal

g2558.definition: [κακουχέω] from a presumed compound of {{g2556}} and {{g2192}}; to maltreat

g2559.definition: [κακόω] from {{g2556}}; to injure; figuratively, to exasperate

g2562.definition: [καλάμη] feminine of {{g2563}}; a stalk of grain, i.e. (collectively) stubble

g2563.definition: [κάλαμος] of uncertain affinity; a reed (the plant or its stem, or that of a similar plant); by implication, a pen

g2564.definition: [καλέω] akin to the base of {{g2753}}; to "call" (properly, aloud, but used in a variety of applications, directly or otherwise)

g2565.definition: [καλλιέλαιος] from the base of {{g2566}} and {{g1636}}; a cultivated olive tree, i.e. a domesticated or improved one

g2566.definition: [καλλίον] neuter of the (irregular) comparative of {{g2570}}; (adverbially) better than many

g2567.definition: [καλοδιδάσκαλος] from {{g2570}} and {{g1320}}; a teacher of the right

g2568.definition: [Καλοὶ Λιμένες] plural of {{g2570}} and {{g3040}}; Good Harbors, i.e. Fairhaven, a bay of Crete

g2569.definition: [καλοποιέω] from {{g2570}} and {{g4160}}; to do well, i.e. live virtuously

g2570.definition: [καλός] of uncertain affinity; properly, beautiful, but chiefly (figuratively) good (literally or morally), i.e. valuable or virtuous (for appearance or use, and thus distinguished from {{g18}}, which is properly intrinsic)

g2572.definition: [καλύπτω] akin to {{g2813}} and {{g2928}}; to cover up (literally or figuratively)

g2576.definition: [καμμύω] from a compound of {{g2596}} and the base of {{g3466}}; to shut down, i.e. close the eyes

g2577.definition: [κάμνω] apparently a primary verb; properly, to toil, i.e. (by implication) to tire (figuratively, faint, sicken)

g2578.definition: [κάμπτω] apparently a primary verb; to bend

g2580.definition: [Κανᾶ] of Hebrew origin (compare {{h7071}}); Cana, a place in Palestine

g2581.definition: [Κανανίτης] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h7067}}); zealous; Cananites, an epithet

g2582.definition: [Κανδάκη] of foreign origin; Candacè, an Egyptian queen

g2583.definition: [κανών] from κάνη (a straight reed, i.e. rod); a rule ("canon"), i.e. (figuratively) a standard (of faith and practice); by implication, a boundary, i.e. (figuratively) a sphere (of activity)

g2584.definition: [Καπερναούμ] of Hebrew origin (probably {{h3723}} and {{h5151}}); Capernaum (i.e. Caphanachum), a place in Palestine

g2585.definition: [καπηλεύω] from κάπηλος (a huckster); to retail, i.e. (by implication) to adulterate (figuratively)

g2587.definition: [Καππαδοκία] of foreign origin; Cappadocia, a region of Asia Minor

g2588.definition: [καρδία] prolonged from a primary κάρ (Latin , "heart"); the heart, i.e. (figuratively) the thoughts or feelings (mind); also (by analogy) the middle

g2590.definition: [καρπός] probably from the base of {{g726}}; fruit (as plucked), literally or figuratively

g2591.definition: [Κάρπος] perhaps for {{g2590}}; Carpus, probably a Christian

g2592.definition: [καρποφορέω] from {{g2593}}; to be fertile (literally or figuratively)

g2594.definition: [καρτερέω] from a derivative of {{g2904}} (transposed); to be strong, i.e. (figuratively) steadfast (patient)

g2595.definition: [κάρφος] from κάρφω (to wither); a dry twig or straw

g2596.definition: [κατά] a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined) In composition it retains many of these applications, and frequently denotes opposition, distribution, or intensity.

g2597.definition: [καταβαίνω] from {{g2596}} and the base of {{g939}}; to descend (literally or figuratively)
